subject: Productivity
title: The Steam Engine and Mass Production
description: A quick, practical guide to The Steam Engine and Mass Production.

hook.text: James Watt improved the steam engine in 1769. Human muscle was no longer the limit of output.

buildup.text: Steam power mechanized factories, mines, and transportation. Output per worker multiplied.

discovery.text: Between 1760 and 1840, British industrial output tripled. Machines did what armies of workers couldn't.

twist.text: The engine created wealth but also pollution, child labor, and urban slums. Progress had a dark side.

climax.text: The steam engine proved that technology amplifies human effort â€” for better and worse.

punchline.text: Steam didn't just power machines. It powered a new world.
